intro: Hieracium leucopogon, commonly known as the white-haired hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typical arrangement of leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and are followed by small, dry fruits called achenes. Hieracium leucopogon is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
